snippet: In a letter, Mark Zuckerberg proclaimed his company “was built to accomplish a social mission — to make the world more open and connected.”
abstract: Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg publishes letter proclaiming that his company 'was built to accomplish a social mission--to make the world more open and connected;' observers say as investors scramble to get a piece of Facebook ahead of its initial offering, he wants to paint a portrait of a company with goals far loftier than the moneymakers on Wall Street, and certainly loftier than most mere businesses.

headline.print_headline: Measuring a Giant’s Stature: Zuckerberg’s ‘Social Mission’ View Vs. Financial Ambitions of Wall St.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

snippet: If Facebook's initial valuation pushes $100 billion, it would be far bigger than many established American companies, including Amazon, Caterpillar, Kraft Foods, Goldman Sachs and Ford Motor.
abstract: If Facebook's initial valuation pushes $100 billion, it would be far bigger than many established American companies, including Amazon, Caterpillar, Kraft Foods, Goldman Sachs and Ford Motor.

headline.main: Investors Get the Chance to Assess Facebook's Potential
headline.print_headline: Measuring a Giant’s Stature: Investors Get the Chance To Assess Facebook’s Potential

byline.original: By PETER EAVIS and EVELYN M. RUSLI

snippet: Apps for Apple and Android phones let a user take a photo of a document and turn it into a PDF that can be exported or printed.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column notes apps for Apple and Android phones let a user take a photo of a document and turn it into a PDF that can be exported or printed.

headline.main: Scanner Apps Turn the Phone Into a Fax Machine
headline.print_headline: Scanner Apps Turn the Phone Into a Fax Machine

snippet: Photo filtering software is becoming more sophisticated, and some photographers share filters they have created themselves.
abstract: Photo filtering software is becoming more sophisticated, and some photographers share filters they have created themselves; filter apps provide thousands of ways to tweak the colors, rearrange the background or add new textures to pictures.

headline.main: With Filters, Photos Take On Multiple Identities
headline.print_headline: With Filters, Photos Take On Multiple Identities

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar news. Wednesday's selection includes items on how a Facebook stock offering could affect California's budget, Apple's chance to reinvent manufactur...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar news. Wednesday's selection includes items on how a Facebook stock offering could affect California's budget, Apple's chance to reinvent manufacturing, eBay's data center and Neil Young's take on record companies and piracy.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: iFactory Visions and eBay's Data Power

snippet: At long last, it's Facebook Filing Day. The technology reporters and editors at The New York Times downloaded their own personal copies of the company's long-awaited filing for an initial offering of stock and combed through it for interesting, uh...
abstract: At long last, it's Facebook Filing Day. The technology reporters and editors at The New York Times downloaded their own personal copies of the company's long-awaited filing for an initial offering of stock and combed through it for interesting, uh, bits. Here are the results.

snippet: The 51-year-old chief of consumer electronics and games has long been seen as a likely successor to Howard Stringer, who led the company since 2005.
abstract: Sony names Kazuo Hirai as president and chief executive; he had been chief of consumer electronics and games.

headline.main: Sony Picks Game Chief as President
headline.print_headline: Sony Picks Game Chief As President
